+Broken Battery.name: +Broken Battery
+Broken Battery.details: Why repair trashed ceramic batteries when you can recycle them? Deals massive LR Volt damage.

+Cog Collection.name: +Cog Collection
+Cog Collection.details: Though not particularly sharp, the speed at which they travel lends an unexpected edge. Deals massive LR Serrated damage.

+Long Night Herbs.name: +Long Night Herbs
+Long Night Herbs.details: Harvested and woven together with extreme care, these volatile herbs implode with a savage cold when disturbed. Deals massive LR Frost damage.

+Solid Core.name: +Solid Core
+Solid Core.details: There's much to be said for a chunk of salvaged iron, but you'll have to speak fast. Deals massive LR Blunt damage.

+Whalebane.name: +Whalebane
+Whalebane.details: Named by an amberclad woken from dreams of ancient salt. Deals massive LR Spike damage.

A Brace of Hounds.name: A Brace of Hounds
A Brace of Hounds.details: Perhaps not best friend material, these dogs are at least fiercely protective of their ship (despite having few other uses than comfort and the ability to play a great game of fetch).

A Stretch of Slinks.name: A Stretch of Slinks
A Stretch of Slinks.details: Semi-spectral cats usually found in dockyards and spitcity alleyways, ship-born slinks spend most of their time hunting down rats and finding ways to get into the most absurdly awkward spaces.

Acid Maw.name: Acid Maw
Acid Maw.details:
An open chemical vat that melts down scrap metal, piping the resulting pressurised slurry around the ship. Potent and almost impossible to interrupt.

Fuelled with salvage and scrap.

Aerial Anchor.name: Aerial Anchor
Aerial Anchor.details: A deployable chemical balloon that holds lighter-than-air gas, and a weighted pendulum-style chain below. Ships with aerial anchors may Drift while at height, even if it can't usually Float or Hover.

Aeroviathan Bones.name: Aeroviathan Bones
Aeroviathan Bones.details: Hollow bones taken from huge aerial creatures, resistant to damage but naturally light.

Algae Farm.name: Algae Farm
Algae Farm.details:
Though difficult to maintain, algae farms offer an unprecedented opportunity for tailors and ravellers alike.

Increase the Grow tracks of plants in this plot by two boxes. Whenever you harvest a plant from an algae farm, gain an additional specimen of coloured dye related to the plant.

Amber Hothouse.name: Amber Hothouse
Amber Hothouse.details: Once per journey, roll a d6. On a 6, all plants within the plot gain a rare tag, 'Flourishing'. On a 5 or 4, mark a box on the Grow track of all plants within the plot. On a 3, 2, or 1, the plot has no additional effect.

Ambered Cylinder.name: Ambered Cylinder
Ambered Cylinder.details:
Usually found running the length of the deck, a gyroscope soaked with cloudward dreams.

Takeoff Cost: Tilt Flight Style: Rush, Hover

Ambershell.name: Ambershell
Ambershell.details:
A retractable amber canopy that can fully enclose the deck. The shell's translucent nature allows good all around vision on deck, and the unbroken finish allows wildsailors on deck to benefit from their ship's internal scrubbers.

Deck area benefits from ship's interior resistances

Amoebic Bubble.name: Amoebic Bubble
Amoebic Bubble.details:
A slick alchemical bubble covering any exposed deck area, shimmering like oil.

Deck area benefits from ship's interior resistances

Anchor System.name: Anchor System
Anchor System.details: Lengths of chain with heavy curved hooks, used to anchor ships to the branches of the Wildsea. Almost every ship comes with this as standard.

Anchored Blossom-Scatter.name: Anchored Blossom-Scatter
Anchored Blossom-Scatter.details: When you harvest a plant grown in anchored blossom-scatter, roll a d6. On a 6, the resulting specimen gains the 'Pre-Verdant' tag. On a 5 or 4, the resulting specimen gains the 'Spirited' tag. On a 3, 2, or 1 the specimen gains the 'Mournful' tag.

Angler Fins.name: Angler Fins
Angler Fins.details: These wood or metal fins grant a greater level of control over movements while airborne. Reduce cut on tricky aerobatic manoeuvres (such as barrel rolls and sharp turns) no matter the atmospheric conditions.

Antiballast.name: Antiballast
Antiballast.details:
Multiple canvas balloons placed strategically within the ship, pipes running between them. The gas they fill with doesn't stay lighter-than-air for long, but it's enough to get some distance from the wavetops.

Additional Style: Float

Arachnesque.name: Arachnesque
Arachnesque.details: Less of a hull and more of a giant insect grown to fit the specifications of your frame, usually something spider-like.

Asteroid Anchor.name: Asteroid Anchor
Asteroid Anchor.details:
A chunk of fallen star with unusual properties of spirit attraction. The main mass is almost too heavy to move, but fragments cut from it retain some of its most useful properties for a time.

Optimal Use: Launch a fragment from the deck to clear a burn on any spirit-based Eye. Alternate Use: The asteroid metal produces a low boom when run, which wakes nearby intangibles into true corporeality for a short time.

Atmosferrets.name: Atmosferrets
Atmosferrets.details: Lithe little beasts with shaggy coats, primarily for companionship or distraction at extreme heights.

Ballast Tanks.name: Ballast Tanks
Ballast Tanks.details: Filled with wood chips, spoiled liquids and rusted salvage. These tanks can be opened remotely and their contents dumped for a burst of height while aloft.

Bark Buffers.name: Bark Buffers
Bark Buffers.details:
Used in conjunction with xylem wheel-saws for more comfortable transitions.

When entering or exiting an ironroot's internal structure (such as when using a Xylem Wheel-Saw), make an Armour ratings roll. On a triumph, the usual mark of damage isn't applied.

Bark-Scale.name: Bark-Scale
Bark-Scale.details:
Chemically treated for flexibility, but still liable to catch and drag as a ship moves, bark-scale's true benefits is in the natural camouflage it offers at depth.

Increase impact on stealth rating rolls taken when at anchor within the depths.

Barrens.name: Barrens
Barrens.details: When you sow a plant in barrens, add three extra boxes to the plant's track.

Beast-Reins.name: Beast-Reins
Beast-Reins.details:
An arrangement similar to a leash or yoke, allowing well-trained beasts to pull the ship like a chariot.

When you choose beast-reins, decide what kind of beasts they hold (giant centipedes are a solid choice). A ship with beast-reins doesn’t require an engine choice from the next section, but the beasts themselves do require care, feeding, and sleep.

Beastback.name: Beastback
Beastback.details: A half-living hull of flesh and bone, flexible and unsettlingly warm.

Bilgecroft.name: Bilgecroft
Bilgecroft.details:
What could be more natural than linking a ship's sewage systems to its food production systems? There's a lot to be said for recycling, after all.

Reduce the Grow tracks of the plants in this plot by one box. Anyone attempting to harvest a plant from the bilgecroft takes two marks of Toxin damage.

Bladed Prow.name: Bladed Prow
Bladed Prow.details: A wedge-like cutting edge for slicing into enemy ships without danger to your own hull. Deals massive CQ Hewing damage.

Boarded Bed.name: Boarded Bed
Boarded Bed.details: If you roll to harvest plants growing within the boarded bed, treat Disasters as Conflicts instead.

Boiler Room.name: Boiler Room
Boiler Room.details: Uses alchemical reactions to heat water, which is piped around the walls of the vessel to keep it warm in the cold of the heavens.

Bolas Cannon.name: Bolas Cannon
Bolas Cannon.details: The weighted cables fired from a bolas cannon aren't meant to tangle, as one might expect, but to slice. Deals massive LR Keen damage.

Bonesaw Troupe.name: Bonesaw Troupe
Bonesaw Troupe.details: A single crewmember can heal a mark from any damaged trait or injury when you drop anchor.

Bounding-Ropes.name: Bounding-Ropes
Bounding-Ropes.details: Used for pulling the ship across areas with wide gaps between their branches, slowly and laboriously. Capable of carrying great weights, but need to be secured to trunks and distant branches by hand.

Brace of Kites.name: Brace of Kites
Brace of Kites.details:
Swifter, but far more dangerous than other low-tech methods. The brace of kites is a complex series of sails, ropes, and canvas that can be deployed for a sudden surge of lift.

Takeoff Cost: Saws Flight Style: Rush, Glide

Brig.name: Brig
Brig.details: A hammock. A bucket. A lockable door and a set of iron bars. The cramped conditions of most ships rarely allow for much more.

Broadside Cannons.name: Broadside Cannons
Broadside Cannons.details: A blast from the half-forgotten past, these banks of cannons can only fire at targets to either side of you. Deals massive LR Blunt or Blast damage

Broadwood.name: Broadwood
Broadwood.details: Wooden planks cut from the more reliable trees of the wildsea. Strong and flexible

Brute Turbines.name: Brute Turbines
Brute Turbines.details:
Massive outboard engines that threaten to shake a ship apart. Thirsty for fuel, and give constant thrust.

Additional Style: Rush

Bulbous Gasbag.name: Bulbous Gasbag
Bulbous Gasbag.details:
An envelope of canvas and a unique chemical engine to fill it with a lighter-than-air mixture.

Takeoff Cost: Armour Flight Style: Float, Hover

Buoyancy Tethers.name: Buoyancy Tethers
Buoyancy Tethers.details: Grappling-array style hooks that are designed to latch onto floating debris. Not as effortless as an aerial anchor, but they ensure that an unattended airship doesn't drift from where it's left at all.

Butchery.name: Butchery
Butchery.details: A clean space for rendering and preserving specimens.

Butterfly Swarm.name: Butterfly Swarm
Butterfly Swarm.details: A horde of large butterflies attached by slim threads to a tether or handle, designed to be held while riding a surf-seed to allow travel without a bloomtide.

Caging-Bell Station.name: Caging-Bell Station
Caging-Bell Station.details: A reinforced cage of scrap on the end of a set of winch-ropes, built into the interior of the ship using a rudimentary pressure-door system. The caging bell can be raised and lowered with internal controls.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.details: Plus 3 Stealth when still or at anchored.

Canvas Wings.name: Canvas Wings
Canvas Wings.details:
These use lighter materials and more advanced engineering techniques than other wing attachments. Beating them for lift still takes an incredible amount of power, especially for heavier ships.

Takeoff Cost: Speed Flight Style: Rush, Glide, Flap

Cargo Bay Extension.name: Cargo Bay Extension
Cargo Bay Extension.details: A larger space with cargo webbing, wall racks, and reinforced sections for more dangerous items.

Cargo Crane.name: Cargo Crane
Cargo Crane.details: A sturdy crane for loading and unloading cargo, capable of carrying extremely heavy objects without overbalancing the ship.

Cartographers.name: Cartographers
Cartographers.details: Automatically acquire one normal chart when you drop anchor.

Carven Bands.name: Carven Bands
Carven Bands.details: Made to slide up from the edges of the ship and interlock above the deck, the broadwood of each band is both flexible and resilient.

Casino Hub.name: Casino Hub
Casino Hub.details: Outfitted with stools, cards and fold-away tables, enabling crew to play a range of chance-based games from far-off reaches.

Catalyst Jets.name: Catalyst Jets
Catalyst Jets.details:
The mechanics behind these are simple, but the chemicals and hull reinforcements required are anything but. Known for venting scalding exhaust in their wake.

Takeoff Cost: Seals Flight Style: Rush, Soar Can deal massive CQ Flame or Acid damage, but without the chance of fire spreading.

Catalyst Pump.name: Catalyst Pump
Catalyst Pump.details: Increases pressure within the ship to match the pressure on the exterior. Unpleasant, long-term, but effective.

Catapult Track.name: Catapult Track
Catapult Track.details: A spring-loaded section of deck used for catapulting outriders onto the waves at speed. Great for taking other ships by surprise, but the logistics of reloading an outrider for another launch are... tricky.

Catastrophapult.name: Catastrophapult
Catastrophapult.details: A forked deck-weapon that fires axehead-shaped projectiles using springs and stored tension. Deals massive LR Hewing damage.

Caterpillar Treads.name: Caterpillar Treads
Caterpillar Treads.details: Allows you to move again after dropping anchor (in Dimm's Embrace) without cutting or losing impact.

Centimulch.name: Centimulch
Centimulch.details: When you sow a mushroom, moss, or predatory plant in centimulch, mark one box on its track immediately.

Ceramic.name: Ceramic
Ceramic.details: A shell of heavy baked clay. Ostentatious and brittle unless very carefully maintained.

Ceramic Batteries.name: Ceramic Batteries
Ceramic Batteries.details:
Volt-storing batteries rigged up to regulate and distribute power. Their crackling hum makes nearby insects (and superstitious undercrew) uneasy.

Fuelled with lightning strikes.

Ceramic Pots.name: Ceramic Pots
Ceramic Pots.details: Specimens harvested from ceramic pots gain an additional positive tag at time of harvesting (supplied by the Firefly).

Chainwheels.name: Chainwheels
Chainwheels.details:
Contraptions of rough leather and sturdy chain, perfect for rolling over snow drifts.

Can tackle winter snows without cutting. Deals massive CQ Blunt damage.

Chalk Outline.name: Chalk Outline
Chalk Outline.details: Any storm, rough travel, or damage to the ship has a chance of damaging or destroying the plot entirely. Roll a d6 - on a 6 it's fine, on a 5 or 4 the plants within are damaged, on a 3, 2 or 1 the entire plot is destroyed.

Channeling Sail.name: Channeling Sail
Channeling Sail.details:
Known for providing a burst of lift on takeoff and little more besides that, the bones of the kite-like sail's frame needs frequent repairs.

Takeoff Cost: Speed +Armour Flight Style: Rush, Glide

Charcoal Rattlevents.name: Charcoal Rattlevents
Charcoal Rattlevents.details:
A system of air vents and mechanical filters, powered by the engine. Finally, a use for charcoal!

Ship interior resists bad air and drifting spores

Chattergulls.name: Chattergulls
Chattergulls.details: Avian messengers with remarkable sound-mimicking abilities, used to transmit messages between airships.

Chemical Compressor.name: Chemical Compressor
Chemical Compressor.details:
The most common engine on the rustling waves, reliably unreliable but extremely easy to fuel.

Fuelled with crushed fruit and insect husks.

Chemical Spray.name: Chemical Spray
Chemical Spray.details:
Better doused in noxious alchemical solutions of unknown and unsettling origin than crezzerin. Probably.

Crew that have time to douse themselves before leaving the ship at depth gain a temporary 2-track benefit, Soaked, which gives crezzerin resistance.

Chemicowork Rockets.name: Chemicowork Rockets
Chemicowork Rockets.details:
Both baffler an makeshift weapon, these carefully packed rockets burst with colourful chemical spray.

Optimal Use: Fire at night to clear a burn from any predator-based eye. Alternate Use: Fire for a single burst of Massive LR Acid damage.

Chitin Segmento.name: Chitin Segmento
Chitin Segmento.details:
Nowhere near as effective as its iron counterpart at resisting damage, the chitin segmento is still popular among submariners thanks to the innate ability of its semi-living plating to push back against the depths.

Deck area benefits from ship's interior resistances

Chitinous.name: Chitinous
Chitinous.details: Made from the collected shells of the wildsea’s larger insects. Smooth, offering little in the way of friction or snags.

Chitinous Mix.name: Chitinous Mix
Chitinous Mix.details: When you sow a flower, grass, or wheat in a chitinous mix, mark one box on its track immediately.

Chittering Cloak.name: Chittering Cloak
Chittering Cloak.details:
Your hull is a hotbed of insectile symbiosis, thousands of chitinous bodies and translucent wings sprouting from wood and iron.

Takeoff Cost: None Flight Style: Float, Flap Reduce cut by one on aerial stunts performed while within mist, fog, or sporeclouds.

Chopper.name: Chopper
Chopper.details: Brutish and noisy, choppers are designed to cut their way through the toughest wildsea vegetation.

Chopper's Offal.name: Chopper's Offal
Chopper's Offal.details: When you sow a nut or narcotic in chopper's offal, mark one box on its track immediately.

Chrysalid.name: Chrysalid
Chrysalid.details: A hull adapted from the cast-off chrysalis of a massive insect, excellent protection against the sea’s incursion.

Clatterweb Spiders.name: Clatterweb Spiders
Clatterweb Spiders.details: When at anchor (or otherwise still) the spiders spin webs around the ship, giving early warning if hazards approach.

Cobra Cluster.name: Cobra Cluster
Cobra Cluster.details: The scattering of high-velocity explosives may lack the punch to injure leviathans, but can put pain to just about anything else. Deals high-impact LR Blast or Acid damage to all targets in a small area.

Colourful Flags.name: Colourful Flags
Colourful Flags.details:
More likely to draw attention than dispel it, some aeronauts nevertheless swear by the things

Alternate Use: A single message in signalling can be sent at extreme ranges that wouldn't normally be possible.

Compact Parachute Stock.name: Compact Parachute Stock
Compact Parachute Stock.details:
A less flexible but more reliable version of the wingsuit, allowing a crewmember to safely drift down towards the waves after a jump or fall.

Crew that have time to don a compact parachute before leaving the ship at heights gain a temporary 3-track benefit, Parachute (this can turn a lethal fall into a controlled descent). The parachute must be re-packed with a task before being used again.

Cooling Facility.name: Cooling Facility
Cooling Facility.details: An insulated room where breath mists in the air, perfect for storing perishables and escaping the sun's glare.

Copper Eaveskettle.name: Copper Eaveskettle
Copper Eaveskettle.details: Containing a constantly boiling mixture of herbs, spices, and searing alchemical liquids, the oversized kettle can be tilted to release pressurized jets of scalding steam. Deals massive LR Flame damage. The steam never sets things aflame, despite the intense temperatures.

Copper Feathers.name: Copper Feathers
Copper Feathers.details:
Whether attached to an existing set of wings or simply welded to the hull, these carefully sculpted feathers allow ships to skim through the clouds for league after league.

Additional Style: Glide

Copper-Fox Flags.name: Copper-Fox Flags
Copper-Fox Flags.details:
Finely made mimics on the end of insulated poles, the wax-sealed fabric and metallic edging of these fake spring-foxes draws the ire of a living storm's lightning away from the more exposed areas of a ship.

Optimal Use: Extend at the right moment to frustrate a lightning-strike, clearing a burn from any weather-based eye. Alternate Use: Keep a ship safe from non-living storms, or charge ceramic batteries.

Coughing Pitcher.name: Coughing Pitcher
Coughing Pitcher.details:
Technically doesn't stop the bugs coming in, just ensures they don't live long enough for an infestation to begin.

Ship interior resists insect incursions

Crawler.name: Crawler
Crawler.details:
Large finger-like mechanisms spread out around the front of the ship, allowing it to move through the waves with a crawling motion.

Deals Massive CQ Blunt damage

Crezzercannon.name: Crezzercannon
Crezzercannon.details: Trying to grow things the old fashioned way? May as well get some use out of all that excess crezzerin... Deals massive LR Toxin damage.

Crezzimenea.name: Crezzimenea
Crezzimenea.details:
Bulbous constructions of metal and clay with stovepipe tops and multiple hatches, filled with crezzer-soaked mulch and specially bred beetles.

Duplicate hybridization results add a new tag to the plant, copied from any existing resource on any member of the crew.

Cruel Greetings.name: Cruel Greetings
Cruel Greetings.details: There's very rarely a second chance to say hello. Reduce cut on attacks against ships and structures by one.

Cumulus Cabling.name: Cumulus Cabling
Cumulus Cabling.details:
Operating on the same alchemical principles as cloudwire, firing slim filaments high into the air that pull the ship along for the ride as they seek out water vapour.

Takeoff Cost: Tilt Flight Style: Float, Hover, Soar Only functions when the ship has a direct sightline to the clouds

Cumulus Hen Hutch.name: Cumulus Hen Hutch
Cumulus Hen Hutch.details: Cumulus hens are uneasy at canopy-level, beginning their egg-laying process only when above the clouds. Once per journey (if you've ascended high enough), gain 'Fresh Cumulus Eggs' as a specimen.

Cupola.name: Cupola
Cupola.details: A blister of glass or amber, usually at the side or rear of the ship, with a small seat inside.

Dandelion Cluster.name: Dandelion Cluster
Dandelion Cluster.details:
Large, fluffy seed clusters that catch the wind, their roots coaxed into latching around the strongest sections of a ship. While not reliable in terms of timing, these massive dandelion clusters lift a ship with worrying ease.

Takeoff Cost: None Flight Style:: Float, Hover You can only take to the air in favourable wind conditions, or with the aid of thermals.

Deck Engineers.name: Deck Engineers
Deck Engineers.details: Automatically clear one mark from any damaged ship’s rating when you drop anchor.

Deckside Shed.name: Deckside Shed
Deckside Shed.details: Even more cluttered than the average workshop, sheds come stocked with a variety of simple tools for the maintenance and preparation of ship-garden plots.

Deep-Delving.name: Deep-Delving
Deep-Delving.details:
No crew travels the depths with regularity without a good reason, or so one would hope.

  • Superstitious markings over the hull, and charms to ward off leviathans (of dubious effectiveness)

  • Honeypot vents to draw insects away from doorways and portholes

  • An array of wilds-clearing tools, allowing crew on or below deck easy access to Hewing or Serrated damage

Delve-Seers.name: Delve-Seers
Delve-Seers.details: You may burn this gang's track to reduce the number of marks on your Pressure Gauge by 1d6.

Docking Crane.name: Docking Crane
Docking Crane.details: A method of launching outriders, usually from a ship's deck. Can also retrieve outriders directly from the waves.

Donatza.name: Donatza
Donatza.details: Droning dragonfly-like insects. Their usually restless activity slows in the presence of larger aerial predators.

Doomed Trio.name: Doomed Trio
Doomed Trio.details: Whenever one of your crew would be hit by a negative Pressure effect, you may burn a box on the doomed trio's track to have them suffer it instead.

Drag Barge.name: Drag Barge
Drag Barge.details: A barge's distance from the main ship means that hazards or adverse conditions affecting the deck don't necessarily affect the barge, and vice versa.

Dragon-Tail Butterflies.name: Dragon-Tail Butterflies
Dragon-Tail Butterflies.details: Butterflies with beautiful, elongated wings. Don’t do anything useful, but are regarded by many as a goodluck charm.

Draketongue.name: Draketongue
Draketongue.details: A pressurized flamethrower that breaks all conventions of logic, decency and common sense. Deals massive LR Flame damage. Treat Triumphs as Conflicts when firing - This will cause more problems than it solves

Driftsail.name: Driftsail
Driftsail.details:
A near-invisible sail woven from the ghosts of old canvas. Ripples and billows in the presence of spirits.

Only effective in areas of dense spiritual presence

Drownberry Bush.name: Drownberry Bush
Drownberry Bush.details: Though they refuse to produce anything edible under most conditions, when they do it's worth the wait. Once per journey (if you've descended to the drown), gain 'Medicinal Drownberries' as a specimen.

Echo Machine.name: Echo Machine
Echo Machine.details: A sonar-like device used for finding reefs, sunken ruins, and hidden ships. Effective use while travelling requires a member of the crew to operate and monitor it, but they gain murksight for the duration (the ability to see clearly through sporeclouds and gaseous obstructions).

Electric Trailblazer.name: Electric Trailblazer
Electric Trailblazer.details: Stored lightning is released slowly as the ship travels, in just enough volume to set branches crackling and snaps of power arcing between leaves in your wake. Ignore cut on ratings rolls imposed by the ship being harried or pursued.

Emergency Tool Rack.name: Emergency Tool Rack
Emergency Tool Rack.details:
Jagserries and sabres are all very well, but the challenges of the underthrash are varied and rarely expected.

When preparing for a delve, each member of the crew can take a temporary 3-track benefit, Depth Tool. The tool deals either CQ Serrated, Hewing, Acid, or Volt damage, chosen when it is gained.

Entertainment.name: Entertainment
Entertainment.details:
• A gaudy appearance that catches the eye.

  • A theatrical stage built into the main deck.

  • Costuming supplies for the representation of various creeds and characters.

Etterescu.name: Etterescu
Etterescu.details: Automatically acquire one normal whisper when you dock at port.

Exile's Copper.name: Exile's Copper
Exile's Copper.details: A rare metal that weighs far, far less than it has any right to, prized for racing-ship hulls.

Experienced Officer.name: Experienced Officer
Experienced Officer.details:
• Any one aspect

  • An experienced officer's track is equal to the track of the aspect they have access to

Extra Portholes.name: Extra Portholes
Extra Portholes.details: A blessing and a curse, these allow crew to stay safe inside their ship while getting a good view of the depths that surround them, but curious predators are sometimes drawn to the light they shed.

False Clouds.name: False Clouds
False Clouds.details:
Usually produced alchemically, a false cloud wreathes the ship in atmospheric vapours to make it far harder to visually track. Real clouds can tell the difference though.

Optimal Use: Deploy to clear a burn from any Eye tracking the ship from below the clouds. Alternate Use: Changing the chemical mixtures used can have unusual, and harmful, results. Instead of clearing an Eye, the false clouds can create a patch of bad air on deck that lasts for the duration of a scene.

Feather-Scale.name: Feather-Scale
Feather-Scale.details:
Interlocking feathers tightly thatched together, capable of flexing with and adapting to the wind but still sturdy and resistant to outer damage.

Increase impact when performing aerial manoeuvres

Ferrogranate Tree.name: Ferrogranate Tree
Ferrogranate Tree.details: One of the most popular on-deck arborist choices, the fruits produced by a ferrogranate tree are almost entirely inedible, but their plentiful seeds are naturally magnetically charged. Once per journey, gain 'Handful of Ferrogranate Seeds' or 'Ferrogranate Iron-Rind' as a specimen.

Firefly Cloud.name: Firefly Cloud
Firefly Cloud.details:
Kept in pitch-blackened jars with their tops wired together, a single pull on the relevant lever fills the air around the ship with a cloud of fireflies. They do come back eventually, if they're well trained (and they survive their explosive exodus).

Optimal Use: Fire to clear a burn from any insectivore predator-based eye. Alternate Use: The fireflies swarm a foe, distracting and reducing vision until end of scene.

Firefly Lanterns.name: Firefly Lanterns
Firefly Lanterns.details: A network of lanterns, their glowing inhabitants woken or sent to sleep with a tap on the glass, ready to illuminate any part of the ship.

Fixed-Band Radio.name: Fixed-Band Radio
Fixed-Band Radio.details: A short-range radio system capable of sending and receiving static-laden signals, based on recently rediscovered pre-verdant technology. Allows instantaneous communication, but relies on fragile antennae affixed to the uppermost portion of the ship.

Flatbed.name: Flatbed
Flatbed.details: Allows you carry a small number of crew or pieces of cargo.

Flexible.name: Flexible
Flexible.details: Built for adjustability and responsiveness, flexible frames are often multi-segmented or jointed in some way.

Flexing Canvas.name: Flexing Canvas
Flexing Canvas.details:
A sheet of old airship canvas mingled with restless whispers, tied to springs and pulleys to take advantage of its constant but erratic movement.

Fuelled with the dropped syllables of the crew's mumbled secrets

Floatnut Husk.name: Floatnut Husk
Floatnut Husk.details:
Though the ironroots these hail from have never actually been found, their efficacy as a natural route to air travel is beyond question.

Takeoff Cost: None Flight Style: Float, Glide Only allow takeoff from the waves, and sit inert when within the confines of a highport.

Floraflage.name: Floraflage
Floraflage.details:
A hull of living vegetation grown purposefully around your frame. Blends easily into the seascape.

Increase Impact when using Stealth motionless.

Fluting-Bones.name: Fluting-Bones
Fluting-Bones.details: Adapted from the aerodynamic structures displayed by countless wildsea sky-beasts. Ignore the negative effects of strong or unpredictable winds while flying or gliding (positive effects still benefit you as normal).

Focusing Amber.name: Focusing Amber
Focusing Amber.details: A screen of delicate amber placed in front of the pilot's controls, with various bubbles and magnifying lenses built into it. Allows the pilot at the controls to benefit from Hawksight, the ability to see further than most and in much greater detail.

Fractal Pseudojaw.name: Fractal Pseudojaw
Fractal Pseudojaw.details: Taken from an inherently arconautic beast of considerable size, the teeth of the fractal pseudojaw dig into more than flesh and wood when they bite down. Deals massive CQ Spike damage. You may mark one of your ratings on a successful attack to reduce a bitten target's immunity or resistance to a single type of damage by one step.

Frenzy-Parrot.name: Frenzy-Parrot
Frenzy-Parrot.details: Possessed of a shrill and annoying squawk, but tolerated as an early warning system for dangerous predators roaming nearby.

Fruiting Tree.name: Fruiting Tree
Fruiting Tree.details: An ancient tree rooted to your deck, laden with fast growing fruit. Automatically acquire a fruit-based specimen when you use a task to tend to the fruiting tree.

Full Nautilization.name: Full Nautilization
Full Nautilization.details:
This is a complete refit of every system, every inch of frame, every plank of wood and piece of stolen scrap to make the ship's interior a fortress against the dangers of the depths.

Ship interior is immune to bad air, drifting spores, insect incursions, and wandering spirits

Galley.name: Galley
Galley.details: A space for gathering, cooking, and eating, filled with pans, cookware, and usually a chemical stove.

Gargoyle Toads.name: Gargoyle Toads
Gargoyle Toads.details:
Clay baked and shaped with arconautic puissance, the unseen tongues of these immobile open-mouthed decorations snake through the air to gather and neutralize drifting spores.

Ship interior is immune to drifting spores

Gas-Grub Nest.name: Gas-Grub Nest
Gas-Grub Nest.details: Portly and squeaking, these grubs produce a lighter-than-air gas as a natural byproduct of their digestion. Once per journey (if you have an appropriate container for it), gain 'Canister of Lifting Gas' as a piece of salvage.

Gecko Sails.name: Gecko Sails
Gecko Sails.details:
A reinforced multi-sail arrangement designed to tame even the wildest gusts.

Only effective in favourable winds.

Geckopads.name: Geckopads
Geckopads.details:
Mechanical legs with gecko-like pads at their tips, designed to firmly grip branches while holding your ship aloft (or below).

The ship never has to cut for movement made to traverse thin or brittle branches Deals massive CQ Blunt damage

Geist Octopus.name: Geist Octopus
Geist Octopus.details: Once per journey, the geist octopus allows a single crewmember to roll 6d6 in place of their usual dice pool on any task it could conceivably help with.

Ghost Spikes.name: Ghost Spikes
Ghost Spikes.details:
A set of spirit anchors sunk into the outer hull, each one tied to the sould of a lost aeronaut. The ghosts are fragile, but they thrill at the open skies.

Additional Style: Hover

Ghost-Oak.name: Ghost-Oak
Ghost-Oak.details: Pale as death and remarkably flexible, ghost-oak is rarely found growing outside the lightless depths of the drown.

Glass-Shell Snails.name: Glass-Shell Snails
Glass-Shell Snails.details: Crews with glass-shell snails on board learn to tread lightly, especially at night.

Glowbug Gastronomers.name: Glowbug Gastronomers
Glowbug Gastronomers.details: Once per journey, the glowbug gastronomers will settle on an edible specimen with a positive tag near the ship (supplied by the firefly).

Glowbug Parade.name: Glowbug Parade
Glowbug Parade.details: Gives all crew members their own dim lantern-like light while they're on the ship (unless shooed away).

Golden Ladybugs.name: Golden Ladybugs
Golden Ladybugs.details: All of your plots have resistance to weeds.

Graft Engine.name: Graft Engine
Graft Engine.details:
A complicated piece of machinery with many amberglass chambers, filled with alchemical growing solutions pumped from place to place through leaf-rubber tubing.

Duplicate hybridization results each fill a box on the resulting plant's Grow track, kickstarting its journey towards harvesting.

Grand Blastbow.name: Grand Blastbow
Grand Blastbow.details: A crossbow-like emplacement that fires explosive bolts. Deals massive LR Blast damage.

Grand Complicado.name: Grand Complicado
Grand Complicado.details:
• Any one complex aspect.

  • A grand complicado's track is equal to the track of the aspect they have access to, plus two more boxes.

Grappling Array.name: Grappling Array
Grappling Array.details:
Prow-mounted grappling hooks that are fired out to catch on branches and then laboriously wound back in for slow, inexorable progress.

A ship running solely on a grappling array can’t Forge Ahead during a journey. Deals massive LR Spike damage.

Grave Figurehead.name: Grave Figurehead
Grave Figurehead.details: The figurehead's carvings are carefully designed to have a mesmeric effect on the nearly-lost. Automatically acquire a spirit-based resource when you move through an area of dense phantasmal presence or encounter wandering spirits.

Greenthumbs.name: Greenthumbs
Greenthumbs.details: Adding seeds to a ship-garden plot doesn't use a task.

Ground Whispers.name: Ground Whispers
Ground Whispers.details: When any member of the crew furthers or satisfies a drive, mark the tracks of all plants sown in ground whispers. That is the only way to mark the tracks of such plants.

Hakebasu's Spear.name: Hakebasu's Spear
Hakebasu's Spear.details: A glowing conductive wire attached to a tiny grasping hook, shots with the spear seem to do little damage until the built-in ceramic batteries are fully activated. Deals massive LR Volt damage. Reduce cut if fired in pitch darkness.

Harpoon Turret.name: Harpoon Turret
Harpoon Turret.details: Fires barbed spears for piercing the hulls of ships and the hides of larger creatures. Deals massive LR Spike damage.

Hauling.name: Hauling
Hauling.details:
• Gangplanks, winches, and bay doors for swift loading and unloading at port

  • An expanded cargo area with extra security and webbing for odd-shaped packages

  • A reliable cargo crane built into the ship's structure for holding and transporting particularly heavy crates and objects

Hawks-Eye Moth.name: Hawks-Eye Moth
Hawks-Eye Moth.details: A moth the size of a large dog, whose wing patterning stare outward to confuse and intimidate potential predators... including the ever-hungry sky. Reduce cut by one when trying to resist the effects of Scrutiny while near a ship's hawks-eye moth.

Heart-Seeker.name: Heart-Seeker
Heart-Seeker.details: Loaded with living shells that hunger for glory far beyond their means. Reduce cut on attacks against leviathans and protoleviathans by one.

Heaven-Hewn Carving.name: Heaven-Hewn Carving
Heaven-Hewn Carving.details:
The details of the carving are incidental - the true power lies in the origin of the stone, mined from a floating island or stolen from a crumbling aerial temple.

Takeoff Cost: Speed Flight Style: Float, Hover, Glide

Helioweaver.name: Helioweaver
Helioweaver.details:
An arconautic marvel that briefly braids and crystallizes sunlight, riding the resulting shimmer like a rail.

Takeoff Cost: Saws Flight Style: Rush, Soar Only functions when the ship is in direct sunlight

Hewn Amber.name: Hewn Amber
Hewn Amber.details: Cut and shaped from massive chunks of hardened ironroot resin, this hull material is prized for its golden glow but is an absolute bastard to repair without the aid of a lowport drydock.

Hollow Beast Skull.name: Hollow Beast Skull
Hollow Beast Skull.details: All plants grown within a beast skull are immune to predation from beasts (but not insects).

Hollowtooth Array.name: Hollowtooth Array
Hollowtooth Array.details:
Ringing the ship's deck like they would a leviathan's lower jaw, the gas-filled nature of these fangs does little to quiet the discomforted murmurs of the undercrew.

Takeoff Cost: Saws Flight Style: Float, Rush, Hover, Glide Reduce cut by one on aerial stunts performed while harried or pursued by an aerial threat.

Hood-Willow.name: Hood-Willow
Hood-Willow.details: A tree growing from the deck itself, some quirk of plant biology leaves the hood-willow extremely protective of the space beneath its branches.

Howling Scarecrow.name: Howling Scarecrow
Howling Scarecrow.details: • All of your plots have resistance to predation from beasts

Hull Clamps.name: Hull Clamps
Hull Clamps.details: A set of docking clamps on the outside of the ship to hold an outrider in place, most often used for holding life rafts and small transport skippers.

Hullbreaker Wings.name: Hullbreaker Wings
Hullbreaker Wings.details:
Don't let the disarming honesty of their name fool you; there are far better choices than these creaking mechanical deathtraps.

Takeoff Cost: Speed + Seals Flight Style: Rush, Flap

Hunter's Anchor.name: Hunter's Anchor
Hunter's Anchor.details: Each massive bolt launched from this crossbow is attached to a chain wound around the ship's frame. Deals massive LR Spike damage. You may mark one of your ratings to tether a target hit by the hunter's anchor to your ship, forcing it to break free before it can flee (or pull you with it as it moves, if it's strong enough).

Hunting.name: Hunting
Hunting.details:
• Trophies of bone, fur, or chitin prominently displayed on the outer hull.

  • A modified cargo area complete with animal pens.

  • An array of hunting and butchery tools, allowing crew fighting on or below decks easy access to CQ Keen or Spike damage.

Husk-Scale.name: Husk-Scale
Husk-Scale.details:
A flexible, organic hull material made from alchemically altered fruits and mushrooms.

Damage to a ship's Armour and Seals ratings can be repaired using garden-grown specimens, rather than the usual salvage required.

Hydroponics Nook.name: Hydroponics Nook
Hydroponics Nook.details: When you sow a plant in a hydroponics nook, mark the first box on its track immediately.

Icteric Shale.name: Icteric Shale
Icteric Shale.details: When you sow a herb, spice, or succulent in icteric shale, mark one box on its track immediately.

Impellers.name: Impellers
Impellers.details:
Large jet-like outboard engines that push the ship through the waves with brute force.

Deals Massive CQ Serrated damage

Internal Seed Bank.name: Internal Seed Bank
Internal Seed Bank.details:
A room not only dedicated to safely storing seeds, but to leaching them of crezzerin contamination through painfully slow but reliable methods used by generations of parasite farmers.

At the beginning of a journey, choose a single set of seeds with the Wild or Rampant tag. At the end of the journey, those seeds lose their original tag and gain the Parasite tag instead.

Iris Under-Bay.name: Iris Under-Bay
Iris Under-Bay.details: An airlock-type room usually found at the base of a ship, complete with a sliding door arrangement for easy ingress and egress.

Ironshard Sail.name: Ironshard Sail
Ironshard Sail.details:
A shard of old-world iron, usually split into two side-mounted runners. Channeled voltaic current causes them to react to distant metals to lift the ship.

Takeoff Cost: Tilt Flight Style: Float, Hover, Soar Reduce cut by one on aerial stunts performed in strong or known magnetic fields

Ironsprig.name: Ironsprig
Ironsprig.details: Finishing a journey marks two boxes on plants grafted to an ironsprig (rather than the usual one).

Irrigation Array.name: Irrigation Array
Irrigation Array.details:
The observant might suggest that this is little more than a series of buckets and pipes jumbled together with leaf-rubber seals. And they'd be right.

Arid conditions don't negatively affect plant growth within the ship-garden (unless they last for multiple journeys in a row without access to water).

Jag-Tracks.name: Jag-Tracks
Jag-Tracks.details:
Motorised grapple tracks along the keel and hull-sides; a slow, solid, and reliable choice.

Deals massive CQ Hewing damage

Jawbox.name: Jawbox
Jawbox.details:
Noisy, wood-fuelled engines that create huge clouds of smoke and dust but with minimum chance of flame.

Fuelled with wildsea wood.

Jet-Throat Pitcher.name: Jet-Throat Pitcher
Jet-Throat Pitcher.details:
A delicate pitcher plant with an unexpectedly robust system of root-like exhaust vents. The pitcher's bulb produces flotational gas, and the roots can be angled to give a ship a modicum of directional thrust.

Takeoff Cost: Seals Flight Style: Float, Glide

Junk-Strung.name: Junk-Strung
Junk-Strung.details:
The mark of a ship well-scarred and oft-repaired, a junk-strung hull is barely a hull at all... More a collection of scavenged metal, driftwood, and animal bones; unstable, rusting, and leaky.

Mark your Seals or Armour rating to pull a piece of useful salvage from the hull.

Kaboara.name: Kaboara
Kaboara.details:
Hideously complex, but undeniably effective at clearing the way, the kaboara takes the form of a series of angled pots, tubes, and funnels used to direct doses of explosive alchemical mixture.

Deals massive CQ Blast damage

Kineticant Colony.name: Kineticant Colony
Kineticant Colony.details: You can cut a path without using bite or engine once per journey. Increase your stealth rating by two marks for the duration of this movement.

Kinsquid.name: Kinsquid
Kinsquid.details: Affectionate tentacular beasties that always seem to be around when you need them.

Kleptothermic Dromats.name: Kleptothermic Dromats
Kleptothermic Dromats.details: All of your plots have resistance to weather hazards.

Labyrinth of Twine.name: Labyrinth of Twine
Labyrinth of Twine.details:
A high-sided plot consisting of angled grow beds, notched metal poles, alchemically treated soil, and an absolute morass of interlinked strings.

Duplicate hybridization results are discarded, having no effect on the plant.

Large.name: Large
Large.details: Can house 10-20 crew with room to spare, many more if necessary, depending on the internal designs and additional fittings. Large ships are most often used to patrol trade-routes around more lawful areas, or to transport settlers and research teams for large factions.

Leaf-Rubber Octopump.name: Leaf-Rubber Octopump
Leaf-Rubber Octopump.details: It's not alive. It's just a machine after all. But the way those tubes writhe, and those bellows wheeze like lungs... Suffice it to say that if it were alive, it would most probably be very unhappy.

Leather Pinions.name: Leather Pinions
Leather Pinions.details:
Folded against the hull when not in use, a ship needs a good turn of speed to take to the air as they snap open.

Takeoff Cost: Tilt Flight Style: Rush, Flap

Lemur Pack.name: Lemur Pack
Lemur Pack.details: A group of nimble helpers that keep the ship clear of smaller insects.

Lens Room.name: Lens Room
Lens Room.details: A room of telescopes and ocular magnifiers offering a commanding view, a good interior alternative to an observation platform.

Leviathan Bone.name: Leviathan Bone
Leviathan Bone.details: A hull crafted from one or more pieces of leviathan skeleton. Solid, if a little morbid.

Leviathan Heart.name: Leviathan Heart
Leviathan Heart.details:
An actual leviathan heart, still beating reflexively, hooked up to the ship. Pumps viscous black fuel through pipes and valves.

Requires no fuel, but in a particularly ominous way.

Levito Bolt Exchange.name: Levito Bolt Exchange
Levito Bolt Exchange.details:
While it may seem little more than a confusion of hissing pistons and thumping hammers, the external section - a series of bolts attached to the hull - allow a ship to surf magnetic fields normally too weak to detect.

Takeoff Cost: Stealth + Saws Flight Style: Float, Hover, Glide

Library.name: Library
Library.details: An overly grand name for what's most often a small cache of books, scrolls, and inscribed tablets.

Library Boatmen.name: Library Boatmen
Library Boatmen.details: Automatically acquire one normal chart when you dock at port.

Light.name: Light
Light.details: Made with the lightest possible materials in the smallest possible amounts.

Lightless Scribes.name: Lightless Scribes
Lightless Scribes.details: Whenever the Pressure level increases, make a d6 fortune roll. On a 4, 5, or 6 gain a chart.

Lightning Rod.name: Lightning Rod
Lightning Rod.details: A multi-pronged metal array for attracting lightning and storing it in ceramic batteries. Automatically acquire a charged ceramic battery whenever your ship enters a lightning storm.

Limited Armoury Rack.name: Limited Armoury Rack
Limited Armoury Rack.details: A rack stocked with simple weapons. When leaving or defending the ship, crewmembers can take a temporary piece of gear with the LR or CQ tag and a single damage type (either Blunt, Keen or Spike). This temporary weapon comes with a two track and can’t be repaired.

Lockdown Protocol.name: Lockdown Protocol
Lockdown Protocol.details:
Sets of printed instructions in multiple languages displayed around the ship, written or dictated by experienced delvers.

At the beginning of any journey you may choose either bad air, drifting spores, wandering spirits, or insect incursions. The interior of your ship is completely immune to the chosen hazards for the duration of your journey.

Longjaw.name: Longjaw
Longjaw.details:
An underslung chainsaw arrangement that extends from the front of the ship, chewing and pulling forward.

Deals massive CQ Serrated damage

Lounger's Tent.name: Lounger's Tent
Lounger's Tent.details: A rest area on the deck of the ship, the canvas providing shade and a break from the wind without being cooped up belowdecks.

Luminous Blooms.name: Luminous Blooms
Luminous Blooms.details: Patches of moss or flowering plants that shed pale light in the darker hours.

Lung-Petal Crawlers.name: Lung-Petal Crawlers
Lung-Petal Crawlers.details: Orchid-like ambulatory plants that naturally filter the air around them. Mark to increase impact on an action dealing with bad air or drifting spores while on your ship.

Luxury Quarters.name: Luxury Quarters
Luxury Quarters.details: Individual spaces for each crewmember to sleep, complete with soft furnishings and tasteful decoration.

Mag-Stone Plough.name: Mag-Stone Plough
Mag-Stone Plough.details: Shards of mountain-stone, heavy with iron ore - they lift into the air at the flip of a switch, forming a floating partial shield at the front end of the deck.

Magnacoupled Kitesail.name: Magnacoupled Kitesail
Magnacoupled Kitesail.details: A kitesail that has no obvious tether to the ship, allowing for complete freedom of movement at extreme range on windy days. When the kitesailor needs a quick return to the ship, the release of a spring activates an electromagnet, yanking it violently but effectively back toward the deck it launched from.

Magnet-Fishers.name: Magnet-Fishers
Magnet-Fishers.details: Automatically acquire one normal piece of salvage when you drop anchor.

Magnetic Coils.name: Magnetic Coils
Magnetic Coils.details:
Spinning cylinders that, ideally, maintain a state of almost perpetual motion.

Fuelled with magnetic scrap.

Magnetic Spiral.name: Magnetic Spiral
Magnetic Spiral.details: Used to accelerate torbedoes to such ridiculous speeds that they shatter on impact. Charges fired deal their damage to all targets in a small area.

Magneticactus.name: Magneticactus
Magneticactus.details:
Technically it's only the spines that are used, drilled into the outer sections of a ship where they can resonate with magnetic fields. Attaching them to the outer hull correctly is a challenge in and of itself.

Takeoff Cost: Speed Flight Style: Float, Hover, Soar

Makeshift Suits.name: Makeshift Suits
Makeshift Suits.details:
Uncomfortable to wear for long periods, these suits provide a modicum of protection against depth-related hazards the crew might encounter outside of the ship.

Crew that have time to suit up before leaving the ship gain a temporary 4-track benefit, Makeshift Suit (which may have negative effects on movement). The number of boxes on this track is reduced whenever the Pressure Level increases, unmarked boxes first.

Mangrove Cutting.name: Mangrove Cutting
Mangrove Cutting.details: Grisly remains harvested from a particular underthrash tree, avoided by undercrew whenever they can help it. Whenever the Pressure Level increases, make a d6 fortune roll. On a 4, 5, or 6, gain a whisper.

Mantis Sentries.name: Mantis Sentries
Mantis Sentries.details: Automatically acquire one normal specimen when you dock at port.

Marauders.name: Marauders
Marauders.details: They fight in close combat to defend the ship, gaining focus every now and then to deal CQ Blunt, Keen or Spike damage.

Medical Bay.name: Medical Bay
Medical Bay.details: A clean space with tables and soft beds for the wounded and their carers.

Medical Mosquitoes.name: Medical Mosquitoes
Medical Mosquitoes.details: Infections and viruses don't naturally transfer from crewmember to crewmember.

Memorial Cairn-Garden.name: Memorial Cairn-Garden
Memorial Cairn-Garden.details:
Gravedirt is rare in a world of sea-burials, but some hew to ways older than the waves.

Increase the track length of plants in the cairn-garden by two boxes. The first time a plant growing or harvested from the cairn-garden would gain a negative tag, ignore it (once per journey).

Memory of Flame.name: Memory of Flame
Memory of Flame.details: A spool wound with the whispers of those that have witnessed the conflagration first-hand. When released, targets split and buckle as if burned without any of the associated risk of spreading fire or searing pain. Deals massive LR Flame damage.

Monument.name: Monument
Monument.details:
An absurd affectation in a world of flexible branches and endless depth, monument hulls are made of appallingly heavy mountain-stone.

A ship with a monument hull can’t Forge Ahead during a journey.

Monument Soil.name: Monument Soil
Monument Soil.details: When you sow a vegetable or legume in monument soil, mark one box on its track immediately.

Motive Moment.name: Motive Moment
Motive Moment.details:
A fossilized whisper of motion-based words, trapped and spinning drunkenly like a broken phonograph record.

Fuelled by sounds cut unnaturally short

Moulded.name: Moulded
Moulded.details: A single unbroken structure running through the ship - quite a feat of safety-conscious engineering

Mounted Magnet-Rail.name: Mounted Magnet-Rail
Mounted Magnet-Rail.details: A powerful voltaic charge accelerates explosive projectiles to near-impossible speeds. Deals massive LR Blast damage. Reduce cut when attacking scaled targets.

Muffling Wool.name: Muffling Wool
Muffling Wool.details:
Shorn from shaggy drown-dwelling goats, left soft on the ship's interior and lacquered on the outer hull.

The crew treat conflicts as triumphs when trying to hide, keep quiet or go unnoticed within the ship.

Mulcher.name: Mulcher
Mulcher.details:
Grinding teeth in a lamprey-style mouth. Terribly noisy but dreadfully effective.

Deals massive CQ Serrated damage

Multi-Layered Fabrics.name: Multi-Layered Fabrics
Multi-Layered Fabrics.details:
A huge step up from just jamming rags into corners

Ship interior resists drifting spores

Mutamulch.name: Mutamulch
Mutamulch.details: Specimens grown in mutamulch gain an additional negative tag at time of harvesting (supplied by the Firefly).

Myconic Struts.name: Myconic Struts
Myconic Struts.details: Does nothing to protect the ship from other spores (or any other depth-specific dangers), but a fungal reinforcement to the ship's frame helps it withstand the physical aspects of increasing pressure.

Mycovent Exchange.name: Mycovent Exchange
Mycovent Exchange.details:
A funnel system that extracts and redirects energy from spore-thick air

Fuelled by travelling through sporeclouds

Mydas Duskdew.name: Mydas Duskdew
Mydas Duskdew.details: Though the arconautic processes behind the plant's transformative properties border on the inscrutable, they're hard to ignore. Once per journey, gain an insect specimen with the Golden tag.

Nailed Whispers.name: Nailed Whispers
Nailed Whispers.details:
You can see them, sometimes, like dust in a sunbeam.

Ship interior resists insect incursions and wandering spirits

Nano.name: Nano
Nano.details: Suited for a single sailor and maybe a passenger or two. Perfect for the lone wildsailor, possessed of excess bravery (or a deathwish).

Navapede Limbs.name: Navapede Limbs
Navapede Limbs.details:
Centipedal limbs lining the hull, letting a ship scuttle through the thrash. If such a vessel could truly now be called a ship, of course.

Deals massive CQ Spike damage

Navigational Ordinator.name: Navigational Ordinator
Navigational Ordinator.details: Though the machine is large enough to require its own room on the ship, technicians swear that withing fifty years it'll be the size of a compass. Ignore any negative effects of Pressure or Scrutiny when rolling to manoeuvre the ship.

Navigational Suite.name: Navigational Suite
Navigational Suite.details: A room devoted to the storage and usage of maps, charts, and navigational equipment.

Night Farm.name: Night Farm
Night Farm.details: A dark, covered soilpit for growing mushrooms. Automatically acquire a mushroom-based specimen when you use a task to tend to the night farm.

Nimbus Sages.name: Nimbus Sages
Nimbus Sages.details: Automatically acquire a weather-based chart after a storm (or other unusual weather-based event).

Nimbus Tin.name: Nimbus Tin
Nimbus Tin.details: Though less impressive in terms of defence than iron or steel, nimbus tin is light enough not to interfere too much with aerial movement... Plus the odd mottling colour is a good match for the wild skies.

Nothing but Hope.name: Nothing but Hope
Nothing but Hope.details: Your ship travels the depths without reinforcement, the crew relying on silent prayers to keep pressure at bay.

Observation Platform.name: Observation Platform
Observation Platform.details: A strut-like protuberance giving an unparalleled view of the surrounding waves, usually with some kind of line of communication to the pilot's cabin.

Ornery Bark.name: Ornery Bark
Ornery Bark.details: When you sow a fruit, berry, or moss in ornery bark, mark one box on its track immediately.

Outboard Serroclaws.name: Outboard Serroclaws
Outboard Serroclaws.details:
Outboard engines housing chainsaw attachments, made to resemble a mantid's claws.

Deals massive CQ Serrated damage

Overside Cache.name: Overside Cache
Overside Cache.details:
A collection of mostly useless junk in a rather fancy cargo crate, specifically designed to catch the eye of looters and marauders after being pushed over the edge of your ship.

Optimal Use: Push over the side to clear a burn from any marauder-based eye.

Owl-Arms.name: Owl-Arms
Owl-Arms.details: Mark the owl-arms' track to gain a resource, 'Freshly-Caught Prey'.

Pamu.name: Pamu
Pamu.details:
Parasite leaves that grow directly from a ship's upper hull, and that naturally curl around the exposed deck when their vessel dips below the canopy.

Deck area benefits from ship's interior resistances

Panic Room.name: Panic Room
Panic Room.details: A small room stocked with salted supplies and bedrolls, able to be triple-locked from the inside and extremely hard to break into.

Parasail.name: Parasail
Parasail.details: Designed to pull a surf-seed along using nothing but the wild winds. Requires favourable winds for travel.

Parasite Pitcher.name: Parasite Pitcher
Parasite Pitcher.details:
A large pitcher plant coaxed into taking root in an engine housing, vines intermingling with the ship's systems.

Fuelled with organic material (preferably living).

Parasite Planking.name: Parasite Planking
Parasite Planking.details:
Wood carefully cut from long-used parasite farm branches, treated to resist incoming damage but natural enough that plants can still take root.

Gain two plots on your ship named 'planking rootbeds'. Parasite seeds sown within these plots don't gain the usual extra box on their Grow tracks.

Parasite Vines.name: Parasite Vines
Parasite Vines.details:
Winding throughout the ship, the leaves of these vines tend to absorb unusual elements as they grow

Ship interior resists bad air

Patchwork Crew.name: Patchwork Crew
Patchwork Crew.details:
Unnerving though their presence may be, these whisper-animated sacks of dried leaves and wave-level offcuts can be pushed over the side of a ship to bait hungry pursuers with a nose for the crew.

Optimal Use: Throw overboard to clear a burn from any Eye tracking the crew rather than the ship. Alternate Use: They rarely get much done, but you might as well put those whispers to work. Instead of clearing an Eye, clear a mark on any two of your ship's ratings.

Patchwork Gasbag.name: Patchwork Gasbag
Patchwork Gasbag.details:
It's almost criminal you're being charged for this. Ascent with a gasbag of this quality is ponderously slow, and puts massive stress on a ship's internal structures.

Takeoff Cost: Tilt + Armour Flight Style: Float, Hover

Pathfinding.name: Pathfinding
Pathfinding.details:
• Trinkets and gewgaws from various contacted cultures affixed to the hull.

  • A reinforced engine room with a secondary set of seals or bulkheads protecting it.

  • An array of wilds-clearing tools, allowing crew fighting on or below decks easy access to Hewing or Serrated damage.

Pepper-Barrel Gatling.name: Pepper-Barrel Gatling
Pepper-Barrel Gatling.details: Made for laying down a hail of suppressive fire or shredding smaller targets. Deals high-impact LR Spike or Serrated damage to all targets in a small area.

Periscope Mirrors.name: Periscope Mirrors
Periscope Mirrors.details: Arranged throughout the ship, a set of mirroring channels to give the pilot a more complete view of their surroundings even when submerged.

Personal Modification.name: Personal Modification
Personal Modification.details: What exactly have you done to the thing? Portside engineers would weep. 1. Increase any three rating by 2. Decrease any one rating by 1.

Picaros.name: Picaros
Picaros.details: They fight at range to defend the ship, gaining focus every now and then to deal LR Blunt, Keen or Spike damage.

Piped Air.name: Piped Air
Piped Air.details: A pipe system that carries air from the interior of a ship to nozzles on the deckside, allowing those working outside to breathe easy even when high in the atmosphere.

Plasm Bulkheads.name: Plasm Bulkheads
Plasm Bulkheads.details:
Thin organic membranes stretched over every vent and doorway that open and close on instinct as crew and companions pass through them.

Ship interior is immune to bad air

Porthole Windowbox.name: Porthole Windowbox
Porthole Windowbox.details: Whenever your ship travels deeper than the thrash, your plot is at risk. Roll a d6 - on a 6 it's fine, on a 5 or 4 the plants within are damaged, on a 3, 2 or 1 the entire plot is destroyed.

Portoise.name: Portoise
Portoise.details: The portoise can move slowly around the ship, avoiding bad growing conditions (such as adverse weather) by heading belowdecks. If it is caught up in a fight, it can negate one instance of damage to a nearby crewmember once per scene.

Press Piping.name: Press Piping
Press Piping.details:
Hardly the most powerful engine around, but one that's extremely easy to fuel for a diligent crew.

Fuelled with fruit rinds and vegetable skins.

Promoted Generalist.name: Promoted Generalist
Promoted Generalist.details: • 1 rank in any three skills or languages.

Propeller-Cage.name: Propeller-Cage
Propeller-Cage.details:
A cage housing that holds large airboat-style propellers used to push the ship forward.

Deals massive CQ Blunt damage

Protobound.name: Protobound
Protobound.details: Attacking invasive spirits target protobound before any other member of the crew.

Protoleviathan Skeleton.name: Protoleviathan Skeleton
Protoleviathan Skeleton.details:
The pyramids of predator and prey beneath the waves are malleable and ever-changing, but leviathans and protoleviathans almost inevitably sit upon their capstones.

Ship interior resists bad air, drifting spores, insect incursions, and wandering spirits

Pseudomatic Claw.name: Pseudomatic Claw
Pseudomatic Claw.details: An ensouled machine, similar to an ironbound. It acts as a floating cargo crane, able to drift from place to place with spiritual energy.

Pseudosun Closet.name: Pseudosun Closet
Pseudosun Closet.details: Cramped but relaxing, this small space is drenched with a warm orange light from multiple arc-powered bulbs and firefly lanterns that simulates the distant sun's rays.

Pulsing Cocoon.name: Pulsing Cocoon
Pulsing Cocoon.details:
An unknown insect shifts inside, glutting on dreams and spinning them into an ebb of arconautic force. Crews report intensely vivid dreams.

Fuelled with the dreams of the crew.

Pyramidal Stabilizer.name: Pyramidal Stabilizer
Pyramidal Stabilizer.details: This bulky device detects and corrects unexpected spins and losses of balance. Reduce cut imposed when trying to saw through or ram an aerial obstacle.

Quartzwater Cannon.name: Quartzwater Cannon
Quartzwater Cannon.details: Each shot a kiss from the deepest winter. Deals massive LR Frost damage. Reduce cut when attacking feathered targets.

Ragamoff Squirrels.name: Ragamoff Squirrels
Ragamoff Squirrels.details: Flying squirrels adept at retrieving small resources in the immediate vicinity of the ship, allowing the crew to stay safely sealed inside.

Raiding.name: Raiding
Raiding.details:
• Fortified deck-rails to give the crew cover while shooting (or being shot at).

  • Bulkhead doors that can be closed and locked to isolate boarding parties.

  • An armoury lockbox containing weapons taken as spoils from previous encounters, allowing crew fighting on or below decks easy access to Blunt or Blast damage.

Ramming Prow.name: Ramming Prow
Ramming Prow.details: Allows you to ram creatures (and ships) without danger to your own hull. Deals massive CQ Blunt damage.

Ratwheel exchange.name: Ratwheel exchange
Ratwheel exchange.details:
Exactly what you might imagine, a pure transfer of kinetic energy from restless rats to wheel to bite. Ethical engineers tend to give their rats the run of the ship.

The rats need feeding every now and then, but they're not fussy.

Razorscale.name: Razorscale
Razorscale.details: An exterior of interlocking scales sloughed or harvested from a wildsea beast, sharpened for effectiveness.

Re-Scrutiniser.name: Re-Scrutiniser
Re-Scrutiniser.details: The sky watches, but this ship watches in return. An arrangement of amber lenses and arconautically charged wiring leads to a central screen, creating a simple but accurate radar-like display.

Reclaimed Burner.name: Reclaimed Burner
Reclaimed Burner.details:
An ancient burner that runs on processed chemical fuel, salvaged from the innards of a pre-verdant ship. Requires excessive ventilation. Don't use this.

Runs on processed chemical fuel. Liable to explode if seriously damaged

Reef-Iron.name: Reef-Iron
Reef-Iron.details: Metal plating from decommissioned ships, reshaped for your frame. Durable and rust-resistant.

Reef-Iron Enclosure.name: Reef-Iron Enclosure
Reef-Iron Enclosure.details:
Studded with portholes and rubberized seals, this canopizing contraption affords a superb level of protection for the serious submariner crew.

Deck area benefits from ship's interior resistances

Reinforced.name: Reinforced
Reinforced.details: A simple frame, augmented with a multitude of cycling locks, pressure exchangers, and built-in ordinators.

Rescue.name: Rescue
Rescue.details:
• Emergency medicine for some of the more common maladies of the waves.

  • A photoscope for picking out glints of wreckage or distress flares at a great distance.

  • An isolation room packed with soft amber resin, for keeping the crew insulated from and slowing the progress of illnesses during a journey.

Research.name: Research
Research.details:
• A higher level of general technology on show than average.

  • A library for recording new findings and delving into secrets and lore.

  • A snapograph arrangement, a complex deck-mounted photography system for catching images of the waves and printing them on light-sensitive paper.

Rig-Ferrets.name: Rig-Ferrets
Rig-Ferrets.details: Used to tie and untie knots far above deck on ships that evoke the feeling of the old salt sea.

Rig-Ropes.name: Rig-Ropes
Rig-Ropes.details: Ropes strung up above the deck for various purposes, often climbed, used as safety lines for trips over the edge of the ship, or hung with drying washing.

Ripsaw Prow.name: Ripsaw Prow
Ripsaw Prow.details: A serrated leading edge for cutting through enemy ships without danger to your own hull. Deals massive CQ Serrated damage.

Rooftop Allotment.name: Rooftop Allotment
Rooftop Allotment.details: Reduce the Grow track length of plants sown in a rooftop allotment by 1 box.

Rootwood.name: Rootwood
Rootwood.details:
Hull planks cut from the base of the ironroots, drenched in three hundred years of verdant history and incalculable aeons of lost time.

Once per journey, your ship ignores incoming damage from a leviathan-sized source.

Rope Golem.name: Rope Golem
Rope Golem.details:
A semi-sentient mass of animated ropes running through the rooms and corridors of the ship.

Takes no fuel, but the ropes must be replaced when they begin to fray. Rope golems have an unpredictable will of their own that may manifest at unexpected moments.

Roto-Chopper.name: Roto-Chopper
Roto-Chopper.details:
Some say the aeronaut rotor was inspired by the sawblades of the wild's earliest days. The roto-chopper shows that inspiration sometimes comes full circle.

Deals massive CQ Hewing damage.

Rough Bark.name: Rough Bark
Rough Bark.details: Harvested from the ironroots. Irregular and tough to maintain, but easy for others to overlook at distance across the waves.

Rough-Drilled Deck.name: Rough-Drilled Deck
Rough-Drilled Deck.details: When you create a Rough-Drilled Deck plot, reduce your Armour or Seals rating by one box.

Rowdy Motley.name: Rowdy Motley
Rowdy Motley.details: Automatically reduce the number of marks on the Pressure track by one when you drop anchor.

Rust-Roaches.name: Rust-Roaches
Rust-Roaches.details: Automatically acquire one normal piece of salvage when you dock at port.

Rusted Segmento.name: Rusted Segmento
Rusted Segmento.details: Plates of interlocking iron that can be pulled into place to cover the deck. Low quality in material terms, but good at shouldering incoming damage aside.

Safety Tethers.name: Safety Tethers
Safety Tethers.details:
Running from a ring sunk into the deck to a wildsailor's belt or harness, these turn a dangerous tumble into an embarrassing mid-air hang.

Working with a tether attached is safer, but also clumsier - cut on actions taken with other tethered crewmates around is common.

Salt Signs.name: Salt Signs
Salt Signs.details:
Invisible except under direct moonlight, impossibly complex sigils cover every inch of the ship's structure, forbidding entry to any spectral entity that the ship doesn't recognise as crew.

Ship interior is immune to wandering spirits

Salt-Rimed Wasps.name: Salt-Rimed Wasps
Salt-Rimed Wasps.details: Mark to increase impact on an action dealing with wandering spirits or insect incursions while on your ship.

Salvaging.name: Salvaging
Salvaging.details:
• A scratched and dented appearance, making you look almost like a wreck yourself.

  • A modified cargo area with work benches and tools for disassembly.

  • A grappling crane built into the ship's structure for attaching to large wreckage, allowing it to be hauled onto the deck or towed behind the ship.

Sawprow.name: Sawprow
Sawprow.details: A wildsea favourite, the sawprow is a chainsaw edge that runs down the curve of the prow. Capable of cutting through most obstructions with ease.

Scatterbird Cages.name: Scatterbird Cages
Scatterbird Cages.details:
For those with higher ambitions than insect training, these rows of cages can be opened to fill the air with extremely angry avians. They'll (mostly) return to their perches after working their fury out on anything nearby.

Optimal Use: Release to clear a burn from any Eye tracking the ship from above the clouds. Alternate Use: A fury of claws and beaks cover the deck, dealing Massive CQ Spike damage to anyone nearby (including your own crew, if you're out there).

Scholars.name: Scholars
Scholars.details: You learn a secret of the surrounding waves whenever you drop anchor, supplied by the Firefly.

Scorpion Set.name: Scorpion Set
Scorpion Set.details: Surly, patient, and venomous, often found sunning themselves on railings or hiding inside boots.

Scorpion Strike.name: Scorpion Strike
Scorpion Strike.details: A spring-wound weapon that creaks alarmingly with every judder of the ship, packing enough punch that 'firing' it tends to shake a vessel down to the frame. Deals massive CQ Hewing damage. You may mark one of your ratings to hijack focus and attack with this armament (once per scene).

Scramblepads.name: Scramblepads
Scramblepads.details:
Modeled after an ionjaw ray's flippers, these paddle-shaped pinions work as oars on the treetop sea and directional fins when a ship is airborne.

Deals massive CQ Blunt damage.

Scrap-Mound.name: Scrap-Mound
Scrap-Mound.details: Cut 1 when attempting to harvest plants from this plot.

Scything.name: Scything
Scything.details: Often wedge or blade-shaped, scything frames are constructed specifically to cut as efficiently as possible through the waves.

Scything-Bell Station.name: Scything-Bell Station
Scything-Bell Station.details: A more advanced version of the caging bell, this 'room' acts almost as a tethered outrider when detached from the main vessel. The scything-bell can be raised and lowered with internal controls, and comes equipped with a serrated sawblade capable of cutting through obstructions and effecting lateral movement.

Seven-Tooth Cogs.name: Seven-Tooth Cogs
Seven-Tooth Cogs.details:
Something about the way these cogs mesh and turn is antithetical to spectral entities, and even anchored and ironbound wildsailors tend to feel queasy around them.

Ship interior resists wandering spirits

Shard Chambers.name: Shard Chambers
Shard Chambers.details:
Pieces of a sailing stone are placed at strategic points within a vessel's structure. They abhor the skies, but excel at scudding through the depths and across the yawning spaces offered by rifts.

Takeoff Cost: Speed Flight Styles: Float, Hover, Glide Only functions when the ship is within or below the level of the thrash

Sharpened Prow.name: Sharpened Prow
Sharpened Prow.details:
Simple and straightforward, a honed blade running the length of the ship’s prow to cut through vegetation.

Provides a basic cutting edge, but no motive force.Just about works when paired with oars, but you really should choose something better. Deals massive CQ Keen damage... or it would, if you could get up enough speed.

Shrapnel Cannon.name: Shrapnel Cannon
Shrapnel Cannon.details: Fires clouds of tearing metal, usually just armfuls of scrap offcuts tossed into the barrel. Deals massive LR Serrated damage.

Shutter-Lamps.name: Shutter-Lamps
Shutter-Lamps.details: A bank of lights and shutters for blinking visual signals across vast distances. At least a smattering of the Signalling language is required to use or understand them effectively

Sidewinder.name: Sidewinder
Sidewinder.details: Segmentation taken to the extreme. When dropping anchor the ship can curl around branches or monuments, anchoring itself so thoroughly that even a rootquake can't dislodge it.

Signal Flares.name: Signal Flares
Signal Flares.details: Colour-coded flares meant to be fired up into the heavens to communicate findings, threats, and positioning. At least a smattering of the Signalling language is required to use or understand them effectively

Signal Mirrors.name: Signal Mirrors
Signal Mirrors.details: A method of long-distance communication using an array of spinning mirrors attached to a refurbished ordinator. Can be controlled from the pilot's station or the mirrors themselves.

Silvergrit Exchange.name: Silvergrit Exchange
Silvergrit Exchange.details:
Silvergrit is a tiny particulate substance made from dried sundew stalks, pumped through corridors and out of vents to distract invading insects.

Ship interior is immune to insect incursions

Six-Ring Promise.name: Six-Ring Promise
Six-Ring Promise.details:
A bank of chemically-driven turbines working in tandem, the subject of many airyard arguments.

Tilt +2 (Only when airborne) Flight Styles: Rush, Soar

Skewerjoys.name: Skewerjoys
Skewerjoys.details: Automatically acquire a resource, 'Skewered Insect', after moving through an area of particularly dense insect activity.

Skillful Officer.name: Skillful Officer
Skillful Officer.details:
• 2 ranks in any skill

  • 1 rank in any other skill

Sky-Seers.name: Sky-Seers
Sky-Seers.details: You may mark this gang's track to avoid having an instance of cut count for Scrutiny.

Skyward Harness.name: Skyward Harness
Skyward Harness.details:
Chains or ropes deeply anchored within the ship's structure, a skyward harness comes complete with a well-trained protoleviathan of the wild blue.

Takeoff Cost: Armour Flight Style: Float, Rush, Hover, Flap The harnessed creature can deal massive CQ damage of any one chosen type, except Flame.

Sleek.name: Sleek
Sleek.details: Quiet is hard to come by on the wildsea, but a sleek frame ensures that no matter how noisy your bite and engine might be, you’ll always be low to the waves.

Sleek Sail.name: Sleek Sail
Sleek Sail.details:
Triangular and manually angled, relying on an attentive crew to catch the right breezes.

Only effective in favourable winds.

Sliding Panels.name: Sliding Panels
Sliding Panels.details: While useless as a pressure shell, they make a handy set of movable shields in times of need.

Sluicejets.name: Sluicejets
Sluicejets.details:
Pressurised sluice systems filled with phytophobic chemicals, for coating the hull and pushing the ship.

Deals Massive CQ Acid damage

Small.name: Small
Small.details: Suited for 2-4 people, cramped but serviceable for double that. Ideal for a first ship.

Snap-Fire Grapples.name: Snap-Fire Grapples
Snap-Fire Grapples.details: Useless for forward movement, but excellent when it comes to slamming on the brakes or stopping an otherwise uncontrolled fall. Need to be rewound and reset with a task after use before being used again.

Solar Compressor.name: Solar Compressor
Solar Compressor.details:
Made to store, liquefy, and pressurize sunlight.

Naturally fuelled on sunny days.

Spatterglass.name: Spatterglass
Spatterglass.details: Pre-V glass coated with a thin layer of hydrophobic grease that interferes very little with transparency. Keeps views clear no matter the weather.

Spear-Fishers.name: Spear-Fishers
Spear-Fishers.details: Automatically acquire one normal specimen when you drop anchor.

Spearing Prow.name: Spearing Prow
Spearing Prow.details: A set of reinforced spikes jutting from the front of your shop, for ramming others without danger to your own hull. Deals massive CQ Spike damage.

Spider Colony.name: Spider Colony
Spider Colony.details: Once a tzelicrae, now barely holding it together, a spider colony can achieve little on a ship other than keeping insects and rodents away.

Spinch.name: Spinch
Spinch.details: Submersible Pneumatic Inching Frame'. The ship's extending frame allows it to bridge gaps several times longer than the length of the ship.

Spitting Pitchergraft.name: Spitting Pitchergraft
Spitting Pitchergraft.details: A predatory plant of the depths coaxed into taking root among your ship's planks and plating. Deals massive LR Acid or Toxin damage.

Spread.name: Spread
Spread.details: Distributes the ship's decks and rooms over a wider, flatter area than usual. The ship never has to cut for movement made to traverse thin or brittle branches.

Spring-Foxes.name: Spring-Foxes
Spring-Foxes.details: A pod of spring-foxes that dance and leap through the waves around your ship as you travel. Their behaviour can warn of dangers from the deeper canopy.

Spring-Set Decking.name: Spring-Set Decking
Spring-Set Decking.details: These deck planks have a little give, their absorbent properties reducing the chance of crew injuries when aerial manouevres turn harsh.

Springwork.name: Springwork
Springwork.details:
Wound exhaustively by hand, springwork engines store and release kinetic energy with surprising efficiency.

Fuelled with sweat, labour, and time spent winding.

Square Sail.name: Square Sail
Square Sail.details:
Taut canvas that relies on a strong breeze, this design harks back to an age of calm, clear waters.

Only effective in favourable winds.

Squirrel Flingers.name: Squirrel Flingers
Squirrel Flingers.details: They fight at range to defend the ship, gaining focus every now and then to deal LR Blunt, Keen or Spike damage.

Standard.name: Standard
Standard.details: Comfortable for 5-10 people, but can hold double that number if necessary. The majority of ships out on the Wildsea are of standard size, hence the name.

Stargazers.name: Stargazers
Stargazers.details: Automatically acquire one normal whisper when you drop anchor.

Starlight Dance.name: Starlight Dance
Starlight Dance.details:
Crews that have been taught the starlight dance know the secret ways of distracting the hungry light above, using shape and rhythm to cancel out gnawing need.

Optimal Use: Perform the dance at night with an additional light source to clear a burn from the Hungry Stars. Alternate Use: Instead of clearing an eye, all crewmates who dance can clear a box of mire.

Steam Exchange.name: Steam Exchange
Steam Exchange.details:
There's little fear of fire on the endless snow flats... just remember to turn it off before you hit true seas again.

Keeps the ship interior livably warm. Runs on coal and snowmelt. Produces the specimen, Clean Water, every time the ship drops anchor.

Steam Piping.name: Steam Piping
Steam Piping.details:
Hellish contraptions of tangled piping, rare chemicals, and scalding steam.

Fuelled with water (the cleaner the better).

Steam Whistle.name: Steam Whistle
