Steam Whistle.details: A shrill, piercing whistle used to announce your presence or scare the more skittish denizens of the sea.

Steep-Water.name: Steep-Water
Steep-Water.details: When you sow plants in steep-water, they don't gain a mark upon finishing a journey. However, all specimens gained from plants grown this way gain the 'Delicious' tag.

Stone Eye.name: Stone Eye
Stone Eye.details:
Is this arconautic, or spiritual? A vessel for whispers, or for something far more ancient? Is this the work of some maddened sculptor, or an artefact from before the verdant world, or perhaps a leftover from an age before even then? And, most critically, did this thing just blink?

Fuelled with uncomfortable attention.

Storm's Stolen Heart.name: Storm's Stolen Heart
Storm's Stolen Heart.details:
There's a non-zero chance you'll be doggedly pursued until your crew is fried and your ship rendered into nothing but a charred memory. But, until then, this is a hell of a find.

Takeoff Cost: Seals Flight Style: Float, Hover, Soar Reduce cut by one on aerial stunts performed in storms, living or otherwise.

Storm-Rail.name: Storm-Rail
Storm-Rail.details: Two huge brass rods wrapped with poorly shielded cables, attached to a voltaic generator. Deals massive LR Volt damage.

Storm-Scrap.name: Storm-Scrap
Storm-Scrap.details:
Sealed inside of a triple-locked chamber, ringed with rubber seals and safety cages. If a fragment of storm, even one this small and mindless, ever escaped, it would wreak havoc on the vessel that imprisoned it.

Fuelled with electro-conductive salvage

Stormplough.name: Stormplough
Stormplough.details: Reduce the impact of storms when you're moving through the clouds that make them up. In addition, your ship is resistant to lightning strikes.

Sturdy.name: Sturdy
Sturdy.details: Built to last in a place of temporary things, a sturdy frame helps weather the strongest assaults.

Sundown Roosters.name: Sundown Roosters
Sundown Roosters.details: These birds crow at the setting of the sun rather than the rising, and care little about wind chill or external temperatures.

Sunscoop.name: Sunscoop
Sunscoop.details:
A sail-like array that ripples and surges in sunlight.

Only effective in direct sunlight.

Superstitious.name: Superstitious
Superstitious.details: A sonar-like device used for finding reefs, sunken ruins and hidden ships. Effective use while travelling requires a crewmember to monitor it, but they gain murksight for the duration (able to see through sporeclouds and gaseous obstructions).

Surf-Seed Rack.name: Surf-Seed Rack
Surf-Seed Rack.details:
A collection of flat-topped seeds, each large enough to lie or stand on. Wildsailors can leap out onto the waves with one of these to ride a bloomtide, as long as they can keep their balance.

A player might use Wavewalk or Vault to balance on a surf-seed as it carries them along, a roll that will be harder to make the more violent the bloomtide is that they choose to ride.

Survival Station.name: Survival Station
Survival Station.details: Containing flares, flags, grapples, wraps, and emergency rations.

Sweat-Sails.name: Sweat-Sails
Sweat-Sails.details:
Held low to the waves, unfurled canvases shaped to catch the rising under-canopy heat.

Only effective in favourable winds.

Talongrove Tendrils.name: Talongrove Tendrils
Talongrove Tendrils.details:
Traditionally carved from sinuous talongrove trees, known to grow, flex, and grasp for decades after harvest.

Deals massive CQ Spike damage.

Tamed Hive.name: Tamed Hive
Tamed Hive.details:
A buzzing organic engine of honeycombs and crawling workers, their movements a complex dance.

Fuelled with stolen flowers and unprocessed pollen. Crew can use a task while at sea to gain a resource, 'Fresh Engine-Honey', once per journey.

Tap-Room.name: Tap-Room
Tap-Room.details: For the creation, storage, and consumption of ales, mead, and spirits (the alcoholic kind). Usually furnished with comfortable seating, and maybe card tables.

Tar-Canvas Layering.name: Tar-Canvas Layering
Tar-Canvas Layering.details: Stiffened fabric painted with layers upon layers of protective sealant, covering the deck like a rigid tent.

Temple Fragments.name: Temple Fragments
Temple Fragments.details: Plants with the rampant tag don't take up an extra quarter when sown in temple fragments.

Tentaculari.name: Tentaculari
Tentaculari.details:
A living cluster of tendrils or tentacles attached to the ship's hull, carrying it through and across the waves in an unsettlingly alien motion.

Deals massive CQ Salt damage.

Tether-Lines.name: Tether-Lines
Tether-Lines.details:
Coils of reinforced leaf-rubber and twine, designed to unspool slowly and retract at speed.

Crew that have time to attach a tether-line before leaving the ship at depth gain a temporary 3-track benefit, Tether-Line. The tether-line track can be marked to briefly swing on the line, or to be yanked toward the ship's deck.

Tethered Kites.name: Tethered Kites
Tethered Kites.details:
An array of kites that catch the stronger winds of the lower air.

Only effective in favourable winds.

Tethered Kitesail.name: Tethered Kitesail
Tethered Kitesail.details: A glider tethered to the deck with a long rope, allowing aerial exploration on windy days.

Tetralpaca.name: Tetralpaca
Tetralpaca.details: A small herd of hardy animals taken from the northernmost reaches of the known sea. Use a task or mark the tetralpaca to gain a resource, either 'Fresh Milk' or 'Snow-Coloured Wool'.

The Revenant.name: The Revenant
The Revenant.details:
The first successful Ziggurat design, put together long before most had the wild blue in their sights.

Speed +2 (Only when airborne) Flight Styles: Rush, Soar

Threaded Hullsect.name: Threaded Hullsect
Threaded Hullsect.details:
A parasitic protoleviathan that grows as part of a ship rather than being tied to it in some way, resulting in a pair of massive but functional insect wings.

Takeoff Cost: None Flight Style: Float, Hover, Soar Hullsects absolutely refuse to fly in wet weather.

Threshing Combine.name: Threshing Combine
Threshing Combine.details:
Rotating blades at the front of the ship, with netting and gathering equipment at their rear.

Whenever you Cut a Path, roll a d6. On a 6, you gain a Wild or Rampant seed specimen appropriate for the waves you're passing through.

Threshing-Cage.name: Threshing-Cage
Threshing-Cage.details: An ever-moving arrangement of poles, chains, and blades, the entire rattling assemblage plugged straight into by the ship's engine.

Thumb-Wax Coating.name: Thumb-Wax Coating
Thumb-Wax Coating.details:
Rubbed around doorways and portholes, and then applied liberally to any unusually draughty spots.

Ship interior resists wandering spirits

Tinker Troupe.name: Tinker Troupe
Tinker Troupe.details: A single crewmember can repair a mark from any gear when you drop anchor.

Tinted Lounge.name: Tinted Lounge
Tinted Lounge.details: Tinted amber-glass windows allow occupents to see out, but expensive mirrored finish prevents anyone from seeing in. Perfect for clandestine meetings, and for avoiding prying eyes.

Tow-Line.name: Tow-Line
Tow-Line.details: For the crew on a budget, sometimes there's no other option than to tow an outrider behind the main ship and hope it doesn't get too damaged in the process.

Trained Messengers.name: Trained Messengers
Trained Messengers.details: Flying creatures trained to seek out distant landmasses (or nearby ships), deliver messages to them, and return with replies. When choosing trained messengers, specify the type of creature you’re using (such as dragonflies or crows).

Trained Pinwolf.name: Trained Pinwolf
Trained Pinwolf.details: They fight in close combat to defend the ship, gaining focus every now and then to deal CQ Blunt, Keen or Spike damage

Transport.name: Transport
Transport.details:
• A clean and professional paint job to attract potential passengers.

  • Built-in passenger quarters with varying levels of comfort.

  • A sturdily constructed panic room, suitable for holding passengers unwilling to fight in the event the ship is attacked or boarded.

Trawler Nets.name: Trawler Nets
Trawler Nets.details: Reinforced nets meant to be draped over the sides of the ship during relaxed journeys, catching larger insects and small mammals before they’re hauled back in. Automatically acquire one normal specimen when you cut a path.

Trebuchet.name: Trebuchet
Trebuchet.details: Lobs stones, chunks of wood, or salvage clusters. Deals massive LR Blunt damage.

Trunk Drills.name: Trunk Drills
Trunk Drills.details: The ship can attach itself to the trunk of an ironroot while at anchor, able to weather unexpected quakes or impacts.

Tube-Linked Suits.name: Tube-Linked Suits
Tube-Linked Suits.details: Crew that have time to suit up before leaving the ship at depth gain a temporary 3-track benefit (Pressure Suit). They are immune to bad air, but may have negative effects on their ability to move freely.

Tzarebuchet.name: Tzarebuchet
Tzarebuchet.details: Designed to launch clouds of sharp-edged scree in lazy but dangerous arcs. Deals high-impact LR Keen or Hewing damage to all targets in a small area.

Underdeck Gymnasium.name: Underdeck Gymnasium
Underdeck Gymnasium.details: A set of weights, ropes, and fitness equipment for keeping yourself in shape without braving the treetops.

Underscales.name: Underscales
Underscales.details:
Thousands of flexing scales that worm the ship forward with a sly, sinuous motion.

Deals Massive CQ Keen Damage

Underthrash Anchors.name: Underthrash Anchors
Underthrash Anchors.details: An upgrade to usual wildsea anchor systems so ubiqituous as to be treated as standard.

Underthrash Platform.name: Underthrash Platform
Underthrash Platform.details: A sturdy door leading to an open platform at the base of the ship, usually at the rear, below the riding-line.

Undulate Fringe.name: Undulate Fringe
Undulate Fringe.details:
It's best not to ask what creature this was harvested from, or why it continues to move.

Additional Style: Flap

Unspun Wool.name: Unspun Wool
Unspun Wool.details:
Taken from surly mountain rams, and smells just as you would expect. Keeps noise low though.

Ship interior resists bad air

Upper Jaw.name: Upper Jaw
Upper Jaw.details: The half-skull of an enormous creature hangs above the deck, ready to be pulled down as a macabre but effective covering against the encroaching depths.

Ur-Composter.name: Ur-Composter
Ur-Composter.details:
A grumbling series of compression bins and leaf rubber hoses. Attracts insects, but never for long.

Fuelled with woodrot, offcuts and spiderwebs

Vapour Brewers.name: Vapour Brewers
Vapour Brewers.details: Automatically acquire a resource, Pure Water, after moving through a bank of high-atmosphere clouds.

Vapour Intakes.name: Vapour Intakes
Vapour Intakes.details:
Funnel-like collectors leading to an internal compression engine. Operates in near-silence.

Fuelled with cloudstuff and water vapour, but easily clogged by sporeclouds.

Vinegar Wash.name: Vinegar Wash
Vinegar Wash.details: Once per journey, you can move again after dropping anchor (in Dimm's Embrace) without cutting or losing impact. Refilling vinegar barrels at port will likely cost the crew some salvage (if a port has the facility to help them at all).

Viper's Tooth.name: Viper's Tooth
Viper's Tooth.details: An unstable weapon that fires corrosive liquid. Deals massive LR Acid damage.

Volcrez Plating.name: Volcrez Plating
Volcrez Plating.details:
Lithicraft are too valuable to be traded away to even the most intrepid wildsailors, but the opportunistic may be able to harvest and incorporate chunks of their material from wrecked vessels (or through shady deals).

Your ship is completely immune to damage from flame-based hazards and extreme heat. The crew within it, however, are not.

Voltaic Bath.name: Voltaic Bath
Voltaic Bath.details: An experimental therapy room devised by surgeons and rattlehands working in tandem. A single wildsailor can heal a box of any one of their injury tracks when the ship drops anchor (once per character per journey).

Voltaic Runners.name: Voltaic Runners
Voltaic Runners.details:
Crackling with barely contained lightning, these outboard contraptions let a ship float just above the churning branches of the sea.

Deals massive CQ Volt damage

Vox-Horn.name: Vox-Horn
Vox-Horn.details: A deep, blaring horn that can also be used as an effective voice amplifier.

Watchful Balloonists.name: Watchful Balloonists
Watchful Balloonists.details: When at anchor (or still) the watchful balloonists rise above the deck, giving early warning of approaching hazards.

Water Purifier.name: Water Purifier
Water Purifier.details: A funnel filtration system. Automatically acquire a barrel of fresh water with the 'Pure' tag whenever you drop anchor or cut a path in rainy conditions.

Weapon Housing.name: Weapon Housing
Weapon Housing.details: Deal massive LR Blunt, Keen, Spike, or Blast Damage (choose).

Weeping Fossil Figurehead.name: Weeping Fossil Figurehead
Weeping Fossil Figurehead.details: A creature turned to something like stone by the passing ages, or by the unpredictable energies of the wilds. Greenery shies away when such a specimen draws close.

Well-Traveled Officer.name: Well-Traveled Officer
Well-Traveled Officer.details:
• 2 ranks in any language

  • 1 rank in any other language

Whirling Bats.name: Whirling Bats
Whirling Bats.details: Lend an appreciably gothic look to your ship from a distance, but are unexpectedly friendly up close.

Whirling Rotors.name: Whirling Rotors
Whirling Rotors.details:
When angled precisely, these allow for complex aerial manoeuvres in even the toughest conditions. You won't be able to hear yourself think, though - many crews on rotor-driven ships learn Old Hand out of necessity.

Takeoff Cost: Stealth Flight Style: Rush, Hover, Flap Reduce cut by one on aerial stunts performed in dangerous crosswinds or unpredictable gales

Whirlwind Bolt-Launcher.name: Whirlwind Bolt-Launcher
Whirlwind Bolt-Launcher.details: The harpoon-like bolts fired from this launcher spin as they travel, drilling through even the thickest leviathan hides. Deals massive LR Spike damage. Reduce cut when attacking tough-skinned targets.

Whisper-Spin Gyro.name: Whisper-Spin Gyro
Whisper-Spin Gyro.details:
A pinwheel of barely-visible whispers, each a suggestion of flight or freedom. They offer a smoother flight, but linguistic radiation risks infecting the crew if the apparatus is damaged.

Additional Style: Soar

Whispering Wayplace.name: Whispering Wayplace
Whispering Wayplace.details: A sensory deprivation room filled to waist-height with sense-deadening alchemical slurry and equipped with a piloting console, designed to let whispers guide one's hands. The Whispering Wayplace is almost useless unless one has a whisper related to travel or discovery.

Wicker Baskets.name: Wicker Baskets
Wicker Baskets.details: All plants grown within the wicker baskets are immune to damage taken by the wider ship (but can still suffer negative effects aimed directly at them).

Wickthatch.name: Wickthatch
Wickthatch.details: A mat of wildsea grasses and vines woven between reinforced poles, more for blending in than keeping the crew safe on deck.

Wild-Bay Doors.name: Wild-Bay Doors
Wild-Bay Doors.details: A set of bay doors built into the hull that open directly to the waves from the interior of the ship, allowing outriders to launch and dock on their own or be 'scooped up' by the parent ship as it moves.

Wildbreath Tank Stock.name: Wildbreath Tank Stock
Wildbreath Tank Stock.details:
These pressurized tanks are filled with canopy-level air, allowing for easy breathing even when a ship is high enough that the atmosphere begins to thin.

Crew that have time to shoulder a wildbreath tank before leaving the ship at heights gain a temporary 3-track benefit, Clean Air.

Wildsroom.name: Wildsroom
Wildsroom.details: Smelling of leafmold and musk, comfortingly dark. A place to go to escape the yawning void of the heavens,.

Willowpeel.name: Willowpeel
Willowpeel.details:
Light and flexible, but extremely fragile, even by the standards of the weakest hulls.

Increase impact when performing aerial manoeuvres

Winch-Claws.name: Winch-Claws
Winch-Claws.details: A bank of short-range grappling claws on the sides of your ship, used to draw enemy vessels close for boarding. A tool to aid in close-range encounters rather than a weapon in its own right.

Winding Trellis.name: Winding Trellis
Winding Trellis.details: When harvesting from a trellis, a twist gives the usual resources but only clears half of the marks on a Grow track.

Windvane Rabir.name: Windvane Rabir
Windvane Rabir.details:
Tailor-made to spin with the winds, producing a musical drone that keeps all but the most unusual garden pests at bay.

All plants within your plots have a resistance to insect predation and insect-borne diseases.

Wingsuit Wardrobe.name: Wingsuit Wardrobe
Wingsuit Wardrobe.details:
In no way do these suits guarantee flight or gliding, but they add both as potential outcomes to a list that otherwise comprises of 'falling to your death'.

Crew that have time to suit up before leaving the ship at heights gain a temporary 3-track benefit, Wingsuit (this can keep a character aloft in favourable winds or break a lethal fall).

Winter's Tongue.name: Winter's Tongue
Winter's Tongue.details:
A prow attachment that flash-freezes greenery before slicing through it, leaving a wake of ice crystals as a ship moves.

Deals massive CQ Frost damage.

Wooden Screw.name: Wooden Screw
Wooden Screw.details:
Often mistaken by wavewalking types for some kind of sky-drill, engineers assure dubious aeronauts that this does, in fact, work.

Takeoff Cost: Saws Flight Style: Float, Flap

Workshop.name: Workshop
Workshop.details: A (probably cluttered) room with smithing and repair tools, as well as a mechanical workbench.

Wrecker's Armoury Rack.name: Wrecker's Armoury Rack
Wrecker's Armoury Rack.details: A rack stocked with less straightforward weapons. When leaving or defending the ship, crewmembers can take a temporary piece of gear with the LR or CQ tag and a single damage type (either Hewing, Serrated or Blast). This temporary weapon comes with a two-track and can’t be repaired.

Wrecker's Magnet.name: Wrecker's Magnet
Wrecker's Magnet.details: A curious electromagnetic crane, often used by salvagers. Controls on the crane can increase, decrease, or cut the magnetism entirely.

Xylem Wheel-Saw.name: Xylem Wheel-Saw
Xylem Wheel-Saw.details:
An angled grinding wheel designed not only to tear through an ironroot's bark, but to grip slippery internal wood with maximum traction.

Deals massive CQ Serrated damage. Allows for travel within larger ironroot branches, but accessing and exiting such areas mark either the ship's Armour or Seals ratings.

Zealous Hive.name: Zealous Hive
Zealous Hive.details: Reduce the Grow track of all plants within this plot by one box, but cut 1 when attempting to harvest them.
